pull.title: [doc] 0.11.2 release notes: use original pull numbers
pull.body:
As mentioned in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6968#issuecomment-154931904, my PR adding the first-draft nodes referenced the backport PR numbers rather than the original PRs where all the discussion occurred.  This commit corrects that.

I did leave in the backport commit ids, which I thought might make it easier for anyone running `git log v0.11.1..v0.11.2rc1` .  However, I can also update those to the commits on master if desired.

If this looks good, I'll also port it to the 0.10.4 notes.

events.body:
Wow, nice!

Yes, please leave the commit IDs as is :) It's easy enough to find the commit IDs for master once you have the pull, and the commit IDs for the branch of the release are more informative.
BTW, the document mentions "0.11.1 Change log", should probably be 0.11.2

Amended commit to say 0.11.2 commit log.  I'll PR the corresponding change for 0.10.4 now.  **Edit: looks like that may not be necessary.** Thanks!

(Sorry I forgot to use ci skip)
